Philippines - Coal Exploration

18213091.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Coal Exploration Project will be the
            Bank's first lending operation in support of the
            Government's efforts to reduce its dependence on
            imported oil through the development of domestic energy
            resources. The project's objectives will be: (a) to
            provide geological data for two coal-bearing areas with
            development potential, and thus contribute to the expansion
            of domestic coal supply; (b) to contribute to the
            acceleration of the development of coal supply through
            detailed exploration in a known coal field; and (c) to
            strengthen the technical capability of PNOC-CC in its coal
            operations. The project will consist of regional coal
            exploration in Samar and Eastern Mindanao, to locate and
            evaluate coal occurrences that might be amenable to mining
            by open pit methods; detailed coal exploration in the Lalat
            area of South Western Mindanao, to assess the economic
            viability of a prospective coal area, previously identified;
            and the provision of technical assistance to PNOC-CC in coal
            geology and mining engineering.
